text: 1. Târukshya 2 said: 'The Sa m hitâ (union) is formed by means of the B ri hat and Rathantara 3 Sâmans.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. Verily, the Rathantara Sâman is speech, the B ri hat Sâman is breath. By both, by speech and breath, the Sa m hitâ is formed 4 .

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. For this Upanishad (for acquiring from his teacher the knowledge of this Sa m hitâ of speech and breath) Târukshya guards (his teacher's) cows a whole year.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. For it alone Târukshya guards the cows a whole year.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 5. This has also been declared by a Ri shi (Rv. X, 181, 1; and Rv. X, 181, 2):--

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 6. 'Vasish th a carried hither the Rathantara; 'Bharadvâga brought hither the B ri hat of Agni.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 7. He who thus knows this Sa m hitâ (union), becomes united with offspring, cattle, fame, glory of countenance, and the world of Svarga. He lives his full age.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 8. Kau n th aravya said: 'Speech is united with breath, breath with the blowing air, the blowing air with the Vi s vedevas, the Vi s vedevas with the heavenly world, the heavenly world with Brahman. That Sa m hitâ is called the gradual Sa m hitâ.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 9. He who knows this gradual Sa m hitâ (union), becomes united with offspring, cattle, fame, glory of countenance, and the world of Svarga, in exactly the same manner as this Sa m hitâ, i.e. gradually.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 10. If that worshipper, whether for his own sake or for that of another, recites (the Sa m hitâ), let him know when he is going to recite, that this Sa m hitâ went up to heaven, and that it will be even so with those who by knowing it become Devas. May it always be so!

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 11. He who thus knows this Sa m hitâ (union), becomes united with offspring, cattle, fame, glory of countenance, and the world of Svarga. He lives his full age.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 12. Pañ k âla k a n d a said: 'The Sa m hitâ (union, composition) is speech.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 13. Verily, by speech the Vedas, by speech the metres are composed. Friends unite through speech, all beings unite through speech; therefore speech is everything here 1 .

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 14. With regard to this (view of speech being more than breath), it should be borne in mind that when we thus repeat (the Veda) or speak, breath is (absorbed) in speech; speech swallows breath. And when we are silent or sleep, speech is (absorbed) in breath; breath swallows speech. The two swallow each other. Verily, speech is the mother, breath the son.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 15. This has been declared also by a Ri shi (Rv. X, 114, 4):--

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 16. 'There is one bird; (as wind) he has entered the sky; (as breath or living soul) he saw this whole world. With my ripe mind I saw him close to me (in the heart); the mother (licks or) absorbs him (breath), and he absorbs the mother (speech).'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 17. He who thus knows this Sa m hitâ (union), becomes united with offspring, cattle, fame, glory of countenance, and the world of Svarga. He lives his full age.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 18. Next follows the Pra g âpati-Sa m hitâ.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 19. The former half is the wife, the latter half the man; the result of their union the son; the act of their union the begetting; that Sa m hitâ is Aditi (indestructible).

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 20. For Aditi (indestructible) is all this whatever there is, father, mother, son, and begetting.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 21. This has also been declared by a Ri shi (Rv. I, 189, 10)--

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 22. 'Aditi is mother, is father, is son.'

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
